bash: ./test.pl: usr/bin/perl^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory

the script is looking for usr/bin/perl which is relative path, you need absolute path (assuming you copied the error correctly). edit the first line. also use dos2unix to get rid of the ^M
i installed tofrodos and after that i gave the command dos2unix test.pl
that only converts the file's line endings from dos format to unix format
so, edit the first line of the script and put / before usr/bin/perl
